abstract: Duke Energy and PPL Energy are reportedly engaged in competing bids for German power giant E.On’s United States operations, according to SparkSpread, an energy industry news Web site.
snippet: Duke Energy and PPL Energy are reportedly engaged in competing bids for German power giant E.On’s United States operations, according to SparkSpread, an energy industry news Web site.
lead_paragraph: Duke Energy and PPL Energy are reportedly engaged in competing bids for the German power giant E.On’s American operations, according to SparkSpread, an energy industry news Web site. The Kentucky-based utilities companies owned by E.On could fetch up to $6 billion, making it one of the largest power deals seen in the utility industry for quite some time.

headline.main: Bids Reported for E.On’s U.S. Operations
